required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Intranasal Naltrexone and Naloxone
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of Intranasal Naltrexone and Naloxone Administered Separately and in Combination in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be to determine the pharmacokinetics of naltrexone and naloxone when administered via intranasal separately and in combination in healthy volunteers.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoints of the study are the pharmacokinetic parameter, maximum serum concentration [Cmax], of naltrexone and naloxone when administered and in combination.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameter [area under the plasma concentration time curve - AUCO-t]
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoints of the study are the pharmacokinetic parameter, area under the plasma concentration time curve [AUCO-t] of naltrexone and naloxone when administered and in combination.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameter [area under the plasma concentration curve from zero to infinity - AUCO-inf]
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoints of the study are the pharmacokinetic parameter, area under the plasma concentration curve from zero to infinity [AUCO-inf] of naltrexone and naloxone when administered and in combination.

secondary_outcome.description: To assess and document any adverse events measures
To assess and document heart rate before and after intranasal dosing
To assess and document blood pressure (diastolic) before and after intranasal dosing
To assess and document blood pressure (systolic) before and after intranasal dosing
To assess and document respiration rate before and after intranasal dosing
Twelve-lead ECGs performed according to standard procedures that will assess P wave, PR interval, QRS complex, ST segment, T wave and QT interval.

arm_group.description: Subject received a single intranasal dose of 2 mg naltrexone for a total of 3 times in a 13 day period with a 4-day washout period between each does until all treatments were administered
Subject received a single intranasal dose of 4 mg naloxone for a total of 3 times in a 13 day period with a 4-day washout period between each does until all treatments were administered

Subject received a single intranasal dose of a combination of 2 mg naltrexone and 4 mg naloxone for a total of 3 times in a 13 day period with a 4-day washout period between each does until all treatments were administered

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females 18 to 55 years of age, inclusive.
- Provide written informed consent.
- Body mass index (BMI) ranging from 18 to 30 kg/m2, inclusive.
- Adequate venous access.
- No clinically significant concurrent medical conditions determined by medical history, physical examination, clinical laboratory examination, vital signs, and 12-lead ECG.
- Agree to use a reliable double-barrier method of birth control from the start of screening until one week after completing the study. Oral contraceptives are prohibited.
- Agree not to ingest alcohol, drinks containing xanthine >500 mg/day (e.g., Coca ColaÂ®, tea, coffee, etc.), or grapefruit/grapefruit juice or participate in strenuous exercise 72 hours prior to admission through the last blood draw of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contact site for more information
